title: Thattekad Bird Sanctuary
short_description: Kerala's first bird sanctuary, described by Salim Ali as the richest bird habitat in peninsular India.
long_description: The Thattekad Bird Sanctuary, covering an area of barely 25 km2, and located about 12 km from Kothamangalam in Kerala, was the first bird sanctuary in Kerala. Salim Ali, one of the best known ornithologists, described this sanctuary as the richest bird habitat on peninsular India. Thattekad means flat forest, and the region is an evergreen low-land forest located between the branches of the Periyar River. It is famous for being home to the Ceylon Frogmouth and expansive teak plantations.
wildlife_significance: Cited as the richest bird habitat in Peninsular India by Dr. Salim Ali.
major_experiences: Bird watching trail with a guide
guides_and_tips: Hiring a guide is essential to spot the camouflaged Frogmouth. Leeches are common in wet season.
how_to_reach: By Air: Kochi (44 km). By Rail: Aluva (48 km). By Road: Kothamangalam (12 km).
permits_and_fees: Tickets at the Forest Check Post.
conservation_notes: Habitat fragmentation is a threat. Conservation focus is on the Frogmouth habitat.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive. Evening bird walk. Day 2: Early morning guided trail (3 hours). Breakfast. Kayaking. Visit Butterfly garden. Departure.
safety_tips: Wear leech socks. Carry rain gear.

operating_season.season_notes: Monsoon is good for greenery but bad for photography (dark forest).

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Rates are subject to forest dept revision.
